title: Peugeot and Chrysler to merge to create 'world leading car group'
text:

PSA Group, the French owner of Peugeot, is exploring a merger with its US-Italian rival Fiat Chrysler, it has been confirmed.

A deal between the two carmakers would create a business with a combined market value of nearly $50bn (£39.9bn).

It is Fiat Chrysler's second attempt at a merger this year after it pulled out of an agreement with Renault in June.

On Wall Street shares in Fiat Chrysler jumped 7.5% on the reports.

The potential merger, first reported by the Wall Street Journal, would face significant political and financial hurdles.
